com.epoch.synthesis
Class ReactionCondition

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.synthesis.ReactionCondition
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChemConstants, FormatConstants, SynthConstants
public class ReactionCondition
extends Object
implements SynthConstants

Defines a reaction condition used by a Synthesis. Scope: UI, Session, Data Sessions: QSet, HWSession

Saves a reaction condition to the database.

getReactionCondition

public static ReactionCondition getReactionCondition(int rxnNum)
Gets a reaction condition from the database.

Parameters:
rxnNum - ID number of the reaction condition to acquire
Returns:
the requested reaction condition

getAllReactionNames

public static String[] getAllReactionNames()
Gets names of all reaction conditions from the database. If there are none, returns a dummy value.

Returns:
array of names of all reaction conditions

getAllReactionIds

public static int[] getAllReactionIds()
Gets IDs of all reaction conditions from the database in the same order as the names. If there are none, returns a dummy value.

Returns:
array of IDs of all reaction conditions

getAllReactionIdsAlphabetized

public static int[] getAllReactionIdsAlphabetized(Map<Integer,String> reactionNamesByIds)
Gets IDs of all reaction conditions from the database in the order of alphabetized names. If there are none, returns a dummy value.

Returns:
array of IDs of all reaction conditions in alphabetical order of their corresponding names

getAllClassifns

public static String[] getAllClassifns(boolean unique)
Gets all classifications of reaction conditions from the database.

Parameters:
unique - whether to return just one instance of each classification, or to return an array of classifications that is parallel to the names of reaction conditions
Returns:
array of classifications of reaction conditions

getRxnNamesKeyedByIds

public static Map<Integer,String> getRxnNamesKeyedByIds()
Gets names of all reaction conditions keyed by their IDs.

Returns:
hashtable of names of all reaction conditions keyed by their IDs

getRxnDefsKeyedByIds

public static Map<Integer,String> getRxnDefsKeyedByIds()
Gets MRV definitions of all reaction conditions keyed by their IDs.

Returns:
hashtable of MRV definitions of all reaction conditions keyed by their IDs

alphabetize

public static String alphabetize(String allowedRxnsStr,
                                 Map<Integer,String> reactionNamesByIds)
Rearranges a colon-separated String of IDs of reaction conditions into alphabetical order of their corresponding names.

Parameters:
allowedRxnsStr - colon-separated String of IDs of reaction conditions in numerical order
reactionNamesByIds - hashtable of reaction condition names keyed by their IDs
Returns:
colon-separated String of IDs of reaction conditions in alphabetical order of their names; the default, "no reagents", comes first

alphabetize

public static String alphabetize(String allowedRxnsStr,
                                 Map<Integer,String> reactionNamesByIds,
                                 boolean skip1st)
Rearranges a colon-separated String of IDs of reaction conditions into alphabetical order of their corresponding names.

Parameters:
allowedRxnsStr - colon-separated String of IDs of reaction conditions in numerical order
reactionNamesByIds - hashtable of reaction condition names keyed by their IDs
skip1st - whether the first ID in allowedRxnsStr is for the default, "no reagents", which should always come first
Returns:
colon-separated String of IDs of reaction conditions in alphabetical order of their names; the default, "no reagents", comes first

setMenuReagents

public static void setMenuReagents()
Sets the molecules that should only be chosen from the reagents menu. Called by GroupLoader upon Tomcat startup.

getMenuReagents

public static Molecule[] getMenuReagents()
Gets the molecules that should only be chosen from the reagents menu.

Returns:
array of molecules that should be chosen from the menu

getMenuRgtForDisplay

public static String getMenuRgtForDisplay(int num)
Gets the display-ready name of a reagent that should only be chosen from the reagents menu.

Parameters:
num - position of the reagent in the array of reagents
Returns:
name of a reagent
